text: Draft at the source. Clear golden color. Light cereal aroma. Taste is straw and light lemon.
Draft. A golden beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of malt, alcohol, and straw. The flavor is sweet with notes of alcohol, metal, straw, hops, and alcohol, leading to a dry finish.

Sweet malty, with overt corn sweetness, light fruity notes, grain, grassy hoppy bitter accents in the close.

Draught at Fermentoren.
Clear golden colored with a medium sized white head.
Malty aroma of caramel, corn and hops.
Sweet and malty flavor of caramel, hops and corn.
Hoppy finish.
From tap. Pours toasted malty and caramelish. Fruity, herbal and hoppy finish. Toasted malty into the finish. Toasted malty and fruity finish.
(En fût à la source): Melon miel, lichee et une mornifle dalcool dans une charpente lourde et collante.

On tap @ Beer Revolution. Another craft malt liquor, and this one is high boost. Clear yellow beer with some white foam. Tastes like corn pops mixed with proper malt liquor, actually. Very sweet and grainy but also has that cereal and booze quality that a high quality malt liquor would. Actually does have a little bit of a hop bitterness to it...slightly husky, too. Fun to try, but thats about it for me.

Craft malt liquor mothafucka. Pour is a piss yellow with slight lacing (wow damn). Smells like peaches and cream, heavy on the sweetness and corn. Taste is peachy, cherry, vague sweetness. No alcohol taste for being almost 10%
On tap @Ma che siete venuti a fà (Rome). Pours clear golden with no head. Aroma of malt, caramel, honey. Flavour is heavy sweet, malty, alcohol. High body, medium carbonation. No.

Draught at the brewery. Pours clear dark gold with a small, fizzy white head, short retention with light lacing. Aroma is sweet corn, Pils malt, light alcohol and light earthy hops. Flavor is sweet corn and Pils malt, light earthy hops and bitterness, alcohol and a sweet finish. Medium body and carbonation.
Draft at CBC - pours yellow white head - nose/taste of corn, sweet malts and caramel - medium body
On tap at CBC. Poured a golden color with almost no head. It is a malt liquor ... but it was a legit one. Corny and sweet, but drinkable and somewhat enjoyable. Malty and popcorn.
